intro: Psychotria spathacea, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and striking red bracts that surround its small white flowers. Psychotria spathacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant appearance. It thrives in partial shade and requires well-drained, moist soil for optimal growth.
